benchmark_details.name: ConSens
benchmark_details.overview: ConSens is a novel metric for evaluating the influence of provided context on LLM-generated responses in open-book QA tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To quantify how strongly the output of an LLM is influenced by the provided context.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: ConSens requires access to raw outputs (i.e., logits) of the model used for evaluation.

data.source: Empirical analysis conducted using various datasets, including WikiEval and biomedical abstracts.

methodology.calculation: Calculates the perplexity of the model output under two conditions: when the context is provided and when it is not.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ConSens values indicate stronger reliance on the provided context.
methodology.validation: Validated through experiments comparing answers based on provided context versus parametric knowledge.
